medical_history.chief_complaint: Two days of nausea and vomiting with epigastric pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms started two days prior to presentation with epigastric pain described as a 'tightening' in the abdomen, worse at night. Patient reported difficulty breathing due to pain but denied shortness of breath. Vomiting began the day of presentation with the last episode at 2 AM.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of gallstones; postpartum 6 weeks after cesarean section for first child.
